video_info.title: The Truth About My Depression and How I Got Through it

transcript.text: hi guys I'm Emmy and today I want to
share with you guys my journey through
depression and how I got through it a
little background my depression wasn't a
sudden thing and I would also went
through phases of being quite depressed
sometimes at night I would just start to
really blame myself and like not like
myself I get so anxious I feel like I
can't breathe I can't keep on laughing
like that oh
I have always struggled with a very
negative image of myself I still
remember for many years sometimes at
night I would wish that I would just
disappear or the thought of me being
buried or crushed by something would
sort of be a relief but I wasn't
understanding why at all and when I woke
up in the morning I would just go on
with my life as usual so I wasn't paying
too much attention to them I just
thought like oh everyone has a a little
bit of darkness in them and I of course
was not the most proud of these thoughts
and I just kept them to myself I never
really told anyone I wasn't aware of the
time deep inside I had a very strong
fear of Abandonment rejection self-worth
self-esteem issues that I am only
realizing in the past year as I have
been on my self-work
journey I at first mainly due to
relationships but of course now I
realized there are a lot of other
reasons but I began to sink into this
deep depression where I felt like
there's no light at the end of the
tunnel and at first every day I just
want to sleep because I feel like I
suffer more when I'm awake when I woke
up I just feel like I'm stuck on my bed
I don't have the energy to get myself up
I know to a lot of people it's easy to
think wow you have such a great life you
have a great job you have all these
things how can you still be so
ungrateful and still be depressed and
that's exactly what I thought about
myself at the time and made me even more
depressed and hopeless like maybe before
I would think oh if I work harder and I
reach this goal I'll be happy if I'm in
a relationship I'll be happy and I've
always been chasing these next things
thinking when I get there I'll be happy
and I think maybe I get to a point where
I realize these external things of
course some of them did give me a sense
of achievement happiness at the moment
but there was something lacking within
me that I wasn't aware of and I couldn't
just rely on these external things and
people to feel that void I've always
been someone who is quite Keen to take
actions when there's something wrong so
the first thing I did I tried therapy I
think I went to see at least three or
four therapists and even psychologists
none of them seem to really help of
course therapy is a big part of my life
now but I think at the time I wasn't
even open to it I think at the time I
just haven't met that right therapist I
feel like there must be just something
wrong with me and I'm so selfish to be
acting and feeling like that and I
remember whenever I went to therapy I
would first describe myself at this
ungrateful little [ __ ] who is selfish
doesn't care about anyone except myself
and even though I have no traumas at all
in life and have everything I still
don't know how to be happy throughout my
depression I kept on working and making
content but I think I was sort of hiding
behind content that doesn't really need
to show how I was truly feeling because
I was still processing it and I didn't
feel like there's a point to share it's
not like I found a solution right and I
wasn't proud of my depression either I
was talking with my friend and
considering the option of seeing a
psychiatrist and getting on to
anti-depressants at the time my friend
out of the blue suggested why don't you
give AA waska a try at first I said no
no no no no no I'm not into these things
but then after a while I realized
there's nothing much to lose at this
point so I thought okay why not the key
thing I need to mention is iasa was the
first step that I realized the main
reason of my depression before I was
especially hopeless because I didn't
understand why with aasa I realized no
matter how much I have how many things I
achieve I would never be happy if I
don't like myself in my core I tie my
self worth to all these external
achievement or attention and validations
to try to feel that empty void inside of
me
where I didn't believe that just me
existing being who I was I was lovable
cuz I have to do the work within myself
but I never did before I was just going
through life blindly I always said I had
no traumas but I wasn't aware that and a
lot of the traumas I actually block out
because of human beings very strong
survival Instinct I was not connected to
myself so I had no connection with other
people I didn't even know how to love
myself myself and I've always wanted to
be in control of everything but now I've
learned the more you try to be in
control the more you end up feeling out
of control because most things are out
of your control and people will always
be people that's when I would sometimes
suffer from anxiety and to one point I
just felt like I was this evil person
that did not deserve to live and
realizing that self acceptance and
self-love would be the first step that I
need to make changes in my life and so
that was the beginning after alasa I
flew back to Hong Kong I list out the
list of things that I was going to
change in my life for example
implementing meditation how I would
change in my work no more photos where I
would edit my face or body shape there
was a period of time where no matter how
I look in photos it would not be good
enough until I edit them and I know
that's the first step of self accept and
I also know that I need to start
discovering the good qualities about
myself because for the longest time I
could never never describe myself with
kind words except things like
determination hard work persistence like
more work related qualities and I also
realize I cannot just keep relying on
these external validation to fill my cup
because those things can be taken away
anytime and when that happens all my
selfworth would be destroyed so I need
to start filling my own cup and building
my own self worth and I did feel like
the universe was giving me a second
chance that through the depression the
thought of not finding hope and reasons
to live but the fact that I'm still here
God is not done with me yet there has to
be more in life that I'm here for but of
course despite all these realizations it
wasn't smooth sailing from here and
actually after I went back to Hong Kong
for a while and went back to my old life
patterns my negative emotional addiction
so I book an appointment with a
psychiatrist to hopefully get onto
anti-depressants this was another
changing point in my life because
somehow the psychiatrist that I went to
see was very rude and judgmental towards
me and she said for you the only way to
go now is anti-depressants there's
nothing else you can do that can take
you out of depression and I think
naturally I have quite a rebellious
personality when people tell me I won't
be able to do something I tend to want
to prove them wrong and I wasn't
completely against anti-depressant but
I'm like there's no way I'm taking This
Woman's advice so I just left without
taking any of her pills I went home
decide to keep taking actions to change
in my life so start journaling I bought
coloring books I listen to healing and I
waska music say continuing to make
changes in my work and also knowing I
cannot keep holding on to relationships
that are not in alignment anymore and
also certain behaviors of how I treat
others like generosity I know it's so
important for me to love who I am and be
proud of the way I live my life of
course I'm not perfect I still shule
here and there listening to J shete with
wiard Liz and Louis Haye also helped and
what helped the most and even until
today was listening to Joe dispenser he
talked a lot about Neuroscience of how
to overcome negative emotional
addictions your thought patterns that
were reinforced for many years day after
day in your lives it's almost like one
day when you wake up oh how do I feel
like myself oh I need to feel angry
bitter resentful ah I feel like myself
again the challenge is how do you
overcome yourself so to this day every
morning I start my day with Joe
dispenser meditation which really really
changed my life I've always said I was
someone who's more negative like when I
wake up I would always think things are
not working out and so even before my
depression I was constantly living in
negative emotions and then I hired a new
therapist that I am still seeing weekly
today she is is amazing with my
therapist I start to learn about like
inner child work really going back to
unblocking trauma that I really wasn't
even aware of that I had any we did a
lot of self-worth self-esteem work I'm
still a work in process I do believe
healing is a lifelong journey certain
changes and emotional addictions take
years to overcome but by learning so
much more about self Leve love and
self-acceptance even though I knew that
staying in my old life in Hong Kong in
the previous relationship would be I
guess Picture Perfect in terms of what
the society expectations or even family
friends of how they look you know a
successful life would be and for my work
as well leaving all that behind was not
easy even though I'm still trying to
figure out everything there's still a
lot and the unknown there will always be
in life and I just know that I'm on the
right path and there are a lot of
changes in daily routines and habits
that actually really really help me so I
think I used to rely so much of external
validation on social media I will always
be addicted to my phone sometimes if you
feel sort of anxiety or certain feelings
you don't want to deal with it so you're
just scrolling on your phone trying to
get that dopamin hit but the more you
scroll the worse you feel about yourself
the less your attention span is the less
present you are in your life the more
you compare yourself with others it's
just a vicious cycle before maybe before
sleep I would like scroll on phone for
hours going to sleep feeling bad about
myself but now I would always leave my
phone outside of my room before I sleep
I would shower skin care and then play
piano and another for gotten Joy from my
childhood and when I play piano
sometimes it helped me process s
thoughts and emotions sometimes even if
I just do it for 10 minutes and then I
would Journal I used to never Journal
before I watch cup and I suffer from
sleeping problem for the longest time
like I wouldn't be able to switch off my
mind but no wonder because I would still
be on the phone scrolling and scrolling
of course my mind would still be raising
and so now without the phone when I
Journal really helped me to get all the
thoughts down onto the paper and just
give it to the universe and that helps
me process anxiety the desire to control
things worrying about things not working
out and then if I have extra time I
would read a little I used to love
reading novels when I was a kid so I'm
trying to pick that habit back up
nurture my inner child and then I would
play Joe dispenser meditation as I sleep
but to be honest I wouldn't say I do
night meditation because normally I play
The Meditation and within 5 10 minutes I
would be asleep already I think
something about his voice just calms me
and then when I wake up in the morning
again I won't be scrolling on my phone
in bed because my phone would be outside
and then I would actually do my Joe
dispenser meditation so it depends on
how much time I have it can be 5 minutes
10 minutes if I have more time than 15
25 once a month um I would do like a
longer maybe 35 or even 45 minutes
meditation and then that would already
get me to more elevated emotions and
then I would write my morning Pages how
I started that was that I also came
across this book called The Artist way I
just feel like I'm so lucky that I just
kept coming across these things that
just guide me through this path that
even though I don't know where I'm going
yet but I know I'm on the right path the
arst way basically is 12 chapters each
chapter is one week and it will give you
task it's about uncovering your inner
artist and I know that sounds really big
and at first when I started this book I
was like I don't know if I have any like
inner artists in me basically the task
is every day you wake up and you write
three pages before you do anything else
each chapter it also has some promps for
example it would ask you about what are
the five things you used to want to do
as a child like five alternative life if
I'm not a YouTuber maybe when I was a
kid I wanted to be a librarian fisherman
a lap scientist then it will ask you why
you wanted to do these things and how
right now in your current life you can
bring back these things for example if
you wanted to be a librarian can you
read a little more if you wanted to be a
doctor is it because you wanted to help
people then can you incorporate charity
in your life and that's just one example
there's so many amazing prompts where
you get to learn more about yourself and
these morning Pages really help me
because I realize I'm having so much fun
every day learning more about myself and
that's such a huge progress from where I
was before before of self-hate before I
couldn't even name one good quality
about myself but now it's I'm just
discovering all these things that I love
that excites me and my morning Pages
would be very different from my night
journaling because night journaling is
normally like getting all the things out
of my mind a lot are still about
distractions it's not really about
myself because like I said I'm used to
relying on this external distraction so
that I don't deal with that really
internal deep fear or what's actually
missing so in the morning when I wake up
before the day even begins I'm able to
work more through myself without the
distractions another thing about this
book is each week it'll encourage you to
do an artist date basically a solo date
with yourself it doesn't have to be art
related like painting just anything that
push yourself out of your comfort zone
for example my first one was eating
dinner by myself which I have a fear of
being alone so I normally don't do that
and I have done things like taking Dan
and classes which I felt so
uncomfortable with at the time but now I
know it's good for me because it makes
me more connected to my body and every
class was like um overcoming a challenge
taking singing classes that's something
new that I did last week or it can even
be something simple like taking a sunset
walk on the beach or one week I was in
Hong Kong I went to visit my my favorite
museum when I was a child the Heritage
Museum my inner child was so happy
because I saw all these things that I
used to love and I'm so proud of myself
for the progress that certain moments I
just feel such love and connection and
joy that two years ago I didn't think it
was possible don't get me wrong like I
still struggle like as human beings we
always have highs and lows in life my
traumas didn't just disappear or my fear
of rejection abandonment fear of being
alone
these are still things that I am working
on and trying to overcome every single
day preparing to film this video and
writing down what I want to share make
me realize self love is what got me out
of depression I know sitting here
sharing my journey with you is also part
of self-acceptance and not be ashamed of
what I went through I hope that it will
help you in any way maybe it brings you
a little bit more hope it gives you a
little bit more courage and just to
remember no matter what you're going
through there is light at the end of the
tunnel even when it doesn't feel like
that you do have the power within
yourself to rewrite your story the only
way out is through
[Music]
